title: Best new attractions to see at Walt Disney World Resort in Florida
text:

Disney's six sensational parks are packed with the world's most thrilling attractions, unmissable live shows and spectacular experiences.

Whether you're planning a visit with little ones or teenagers, you're guaranteed an unforgettable experience for the whole family.

And the exciting news is Disney has recently opened a string of incredible new lands and attractions for guests of all ages to enjoy - with even more to open soon.

Below we've given you the lowdown on the newest bits, including the all-new Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge, Toy Story Land and Pandora, World of Avatar - plus a new fireworks display in Epcot to celebrate the past, present and future through dazzling fireworks and special-effects with Frozen Forever.

And there's never been a better time to book with free dining and park ticket offers available for selected 2020 bookings made before 5th November 2019. To book, visit disneypackages.co.uk

The all-new land, Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge, opened at Disney's Hollywood Studios in August this year and it is quite literally out of this world.

Get ready to live out your very own Star Wars adventure in a galaxy far, far away (well, around an eight hour flight away!) at Black Spire Outpost on the Planet Batuu.

It boasts two new must-see attractions, as well as Savi's Workshop where you can build your own lightsaber and a Droid Depot where you can assemble a Custom Astromech Unit, plus shops full of Star Wars goodies and a cantina to enjoy indigenous beverages and curious concoctions from across the galaxy. You can even sip on the blue or green milk Luke Skywalker drank in the movies.

The first new attraction to open in Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge is Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run (above) where you can blast off in the famous cockpit of the Millennium Falcon on a daring flight.

Whether you’re a pilot, engineer or gunner, every role is crucial as you take part in a very special mission.

The second thrilling new attraction to open on 5 December 2019 will be Star Wars: Rise of the Resistance (above).

Disney is promising the multi-platform attraction will be "unlike anything you’ve ever experienced at Walt Disney World Resort" and we can't wait.

The attraction sees guests buckling up to take part in a secret mission in an epic battle against the First Order, with the help of Star Wars favourites Rey, Finn, Poe Dameron and BB-8.

Another recent opening is the fun-filled Toy Story Land which is jam-packed with attractions for kids and grown-ups alike.

Join Woody, Buzz Lightyear and the rest of your favourite characters at their brand new home at Disney's Hollywood Studios.

Take a wild ride on the family-friendly coaster Slinky Dog Dash (above) that twists and turns around Andy’s oversized backyard, go for an intergalactic spin with the adorable aliens on Alien Swirling Saucers and pop on the 4D glasses for a tour through a carnival-themed arcade in Toy Story Mania.

And keep an eye out for your favourite characters who will be waiting to meet you! Say howdy to Sheriff Woody, Yodel a hello to Jessie and greet Buzz Lightyear with your best Space Ranger salute!

Pandora – The World of Avatar

Discover a beautiful land that celebrates the magic of nature at the Pandora - The World of Avatar.

It's packed full of expeditions for adventurers of all ages, with the incredible 3D Avatar Flight of Passage attraction (above) one of the biggest draws.

Wannabe Na’vi hunters are invited to climb atop a winged mountain banshee for a breathtaking flight on the back of a banshee over Pandora’s otherworldly landscape.

There's also the jaw-dropping Na'vi River Journey attraction (below) which has to be seen - and heard - to be believed!

Visitors can enjoy a mystical journey by boat deep into Pandora’s glowing bioluminescent rainforest which is alive with the sights and sounds of exotic plants and creatures.

There's also so much to see simply walking around the Valley of Mo’ara, with enormous floating mountains, one-of-a-kind dining experiences and shops galore.

Epcot Forever

A trip to Walt Disney World Resort in Florida would not be complete without sampling one of its world famous fireworks display - and there's a brand new one to experience at Epcot.

Epcot Forever features dazzling fireworks, stunning laser effects and choreographed kites set to tunes that have become theme park favorites.

It's an epic nighttime extravaganza that is guaranteed to stir the senses and capture all you love about Epcot!

Book before 5th November to dine for free

Below we've listed the full list of perks available on the book early package...

What you get in the deal...

Disney's UK and Ireland exclusive Ultimate Tickets grant you unlimited access to all six Disney Parks and much more.

That means you can visit Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Disney's Hollywood Studios, Disney's Animal Kingdom Theme Park, plus the two water parks Disney's Typhoon Lagoon and Disney's Blizzard Beach as much as you like during your stay.

Also included is a Memory Maker worth $199 so you can capture your magical Walt Disney World moments with Disney PhotoPass and enjoy unlimited digital downloads.

Dine and drink for free - save £560 per adult

Enjoy self-service meals for breakfast, lunch or dinner at more than 50 locations, with healthy choices, quick eats, delicious fine dining and indulgent snacks on the menu, so even the fussy ones will be happy!

At Self-Service locations, guests order at the counter or register. Dine at great themed restaurants like Be Our Guest, Flame Tree Barbecue, Cosmic Ray's Starlight Café and many more across the resort.

At Waiter Service restaurants, guests are escorted to their table and waited on. Enjoy a range of experiences, from family casual to Character Dining (above), and Dinner Shows to the unparalleled cuisine at Disney's Signature Restaurants.

And you can also enjoy great snack options from healthy choices like fresh fruit, to treats like popcorn and ice cream too, which are available at self-service restaurants, select outdoor food carts and merchandise locations.

description: There are so many new and exciting things to see and do across Disney's six Florida parks
